intro: Lastrea confluens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white. Lastrea confluens is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
